intro: Dryandra borealis subsp. elatior, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a member of the Proteaceae family, characterized by its unique, often striking floral structures. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that appear in late winter to early spring. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as woodlands and heathlands. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant plant in its native region.
